oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Burial place of Samuel Davis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Burial place of Samuel Davis located on the grounds of the Davis home in Smyrna.

Sam Davis (1842-1863), known as the Confederate Boy Hero, was a Confederate soldier and spy who was captured by Union secret service agents and imprisoned at Pulaski. Davis was hung after refusing to betray the source of the documents about the Union were concealed on him.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wiles-Hood Photographers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tombs & sepulchral monuments; Cemeteries
